title: my-vignette
text: Compare itr_per_sec lm function R my_lm function
code: code_efficiency_comparison <- bench::mark("homework3::my_lm()" = {   beta_actual <- m2$coefficients   as.vector(beta_actual) }, "lm" = {   beta_expected <- m1$coefficients   as.vector(beta_expected) }) summary(code_efficiency_comparison) #> # A tibble: 2 × 6 #>   expression              min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec` #>   <bch:expr>         <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl> #> 1 homework3::my_lm()    1.1µs   1.31µs   678944.        0B      0   #> 2 lm                   1.45µs   1.65µs   574757.        0B     57.5 itr_per_sec <- as.numeric(code_efficiency_comparison[[4]]) itr_per_sec_ratio <- itr_per_sec[1] / itr_per_sec[2]

title: lm
text: goal R package set Linear regression function (my_lm) find basic information point estimate, fitted.values, residuals, mse, rsquared, adj_rsquared, standard error beta, t.statistic, p.value, F.statistic, df1 df2.

title: lm
text: can install development version homework3 (Linear regression) GitHub :

title: lm
text: Use following code find details “homework3” package (Linear regression):

title: Confidence Interval — my_confint
text: formula input formula y ~ x1 + x2 data input data mtcars level numerical value, significance CI, default = 0.95

title: Confidence Interval — my_confint
text: upper lower bounds confidence interval: CI_matrix

title: Confidence Interval — my_confint
code: data = mtcars formula = mpg ~ disp + hp my_confint(formula, data, level = 0.95) #>                   lower        upper #> (Intercept) 28.01254573 33.459262767 #> disp        -0.04549091 -0.015201645 #> hp          -0.05221650  0.002536338

title: Multiply Linear Regression — my_lm
text: formula input formula y ~ x1 + x2 data input data mtcars

title: Multiply Linear Regression — my_lm
text: List containing following elements beta estimates(coefficients) fitted_values residuals mse rsquared adj_rsquared SE t p.value F_stat df1 df2 CI

title: Multiply Linear Regression — my_lm
